sentences: Evan Lurie (born 1954) in Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States) is an American composer and musician.
Lurie started producing music for Nickelodeon in 2001, as the composer for their show Oswald.
In 2011, Lurie composed an unused song for Nickelodeon's Winx Club (a show that many other Backyardigans crew members worked on, including creator Janice Burgess).
Other notable productions he has written music for include Joe Gould's Secret (2000) and Steve Buscemi's Trees Lounge (1996).
How I Spent My Vacation (1998, with Greg Cohen, Ben Perowsky, Marc Ribot, Steven Bernstein, Bryan Carrott, Jane Scarpantoni)
